segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so focused on that dish, it's like the world around her doesn't exist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water overflowing from the sink, creating a puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's astonishing how she doesn't even seem to notice the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she might be in her own little world right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress and apron look neat, untouched by the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she's daydreaming or just really loves drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are being so mischievous, and she has no clue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit worried for her, hoping she doesn't slip on the wet floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the scene inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she snaps out of it soon and notices the water before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
